title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Derivation of Incidence by Vaccination
text: \[ \begin{align} p_i &= \mathbf{P}(=1) \\ p_v &= \mathbf{P}(V=1) \\ p_u &= \mathbf{P}(V=0) \\ p_{\mid v} &= \mathbf{P}(=1 \mid V=1) \\ p_{\mid u} &= \mathbf{P}(=1 \mid V=0) \\ e_v &= 1 - \frac{p_{\mid v}}{p_{\mid u}}  \end{align} \]

what: Total Incidence as Weighted Sum of Group Incidence
title: Derivation of Incidence by Vaccination
text: \[ p_i = p_v \cdot p_{|v} + p_u \cdot p_{|u} \]

what: Proportion Unvaccinated as a Function of Proportion Vaccinated
title: Derivation of Incidence by Vaccination

what: Unvaccinated Incidence as a Function of Vaccinated Incidence
title: Derivation of Incidence by Vaccination
text: \[ \begin{align} e_v &= 1 - \frac{p_{\mid v}}{p_{\mid u}} \\ e_v-1 &= - \frac{p_{\mid v}}{p_{\mid u}} \\ 1-e_v &= \frac{p_{\mid v}}{p_{\mid u}} \\ p_{\mid u} &= \frac{p_{\mid v}}{1-e_v} \end{align} \]

title: Derivation of Incidence by Vaccination
text: \[ \begin{align} p_i &= p_v \cdot p_{|v} + p_u \cdot p_{|u} \\ p_i &= p_v \cdot p_{|v} + (1-p_v) \cdot \frac{p_{\mid v}}{1-e_v} \\ p_i &= p_{\mid v} (p_v + \frac{1-p_v}{1-e_v}) \\ p_{\mid v} &= p_i \frac{1}{p_v (1 - \frac{1}{1-e_v}) + \frac{1}{1-e_v}} \\ p_{\mid v} &= p_i \frac{1}{-p_v \frac{e_v}{1-e_v} + \frac{1}{1-e_v}} \\ p_{\mid v} &= p_i \frac{1}{\frac{1}{1-e_v} (1 - p_v \cdot e_v)} \\ p_{\mid v} &= p_i \frac{1}{\frac{1}{1-e_v}} \frac{1}{1 - p_v \cdot e_v} \\ p_{\mid v} &= p_i (1-e_v)(\frac{1}{1 - p_v \cdot e_v}) \\ p_{\mid v} &= p_i \frac{1-e_v}{1 - p_v \cdot e_v} \end{align} \]

title: Derivation of Incidence by Vaccination
text: \[ \begin{align} p_{\mid u} &= \frac{p_{\mid v}}{1-e_v} \\ p_{\mid u} &= p_i \frac{1-e_v}{1 - p_v \cdot e_v} \frac{1}{1-e_v} \\ p_{\mid u} &= p_i \frac{1}{1 - p_v \cdot e_v} \end{align} \]

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jesse Smith. Maintainer, author. Tomi Mori. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Smith J, Mori T (2022). covidscreen: COVID-19 Asymtomatic Screening Strategy Assessment. https://github.com/jesse-smith/covidscreen, https://jesse-smith.github.io/covidscreen.
code: @Manual{,   title = {covidscreen: COVID-19 Asymtomatic Screening Strategy Assessment},   author = {Jesse Smith and Tomi Mori},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/jesse-smith/covidscreen, https://jesse-smith.github.io/covidscreen}, }

title: COVID-19 Asymtomatic Screening Strategy Assessment
text: {covidscreen} R package Shiny app designed help organizations evaluate risk COVID-19 potential benefits regular asymptomatic testing.

title: COVID-19 Asymtomatic Screening Strategy Assessment
text: can install development version {covidscreen} Github : using R Windows, need first install Rtools .
code: if (!"remotes" %in% installed.packages()) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("jesse-smith/covidscreen")

title: COVID-19 Asymtomatic Screening Strategy Assessment
text: run Shiny app, can use run_app() visit online version. access underlying model R, can use ct_dist() desired parameters. Running inputs uses defaults; output data.table: can access risk-based metrics used Shiny app using corresponding functions R package. Undetected cases calculated using ct_undetected(), relative risk reduction calculated using ct_rr(), cost effectiveness per test calculated using ct_cost_eff(). Additionally, test performance metrics included R package facilitate analysis performed Shiny app. include: ct_pos(): proportion positive tests (organization) ct_neg(): proportion negative tests (organization) ct_true_pos(): proportion true positive tests (org) ct_true_neg(): proportion true negative tests (org) ct_false_pos(): proportion false positive tests (org) ct_false_neg(): proportion false negative tests (org) ct_ppv(): positive predictive value test ct_npv(): negative predictive value test ct_fdr(): false discovery rate test ct_for(): false omission rate test ct_sens(): sensitivity (true positive rate, recall) test ct_spec(): specificity (true negative rate) test ct_fpr(): false positive rate test ct_fnr(): false negative rate test
code: library(covidscreen) #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'quantmod': #>   method            from #>   as.zoo.data.frame zoo # Create some data using default parameters data <- ct_dist()  # Show data data #>                p   vac   inf  symp  test detect #>  1: 0.0035416667  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE   TRUE #>  2: 0.0006250000  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  FALSE #>  3: 0.0000000000  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE   TRUE #>  4: 0.0000000000  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE  FALSE #>  5: 0.0000000000  TRUE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE   TRUE #>  6: 0.0000000000  TRUE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE  FALSE #>  7: 0.0000000000  TRUE  TRUE FALSE FALSE   TRUE #>  8: 0.0125000000  TRUE  TRUE FALSE FALSE  FALSE #>  9: 0.0000000000  TRUE FALSE  TRUE  TRUE   TRUE #> 10: 0.0000000000  TRUE FALSE  TRUE  TRUE  FALSE #> 11: 0.0000000000  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE   TRUE #> 12: 0.0000000000  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE  FALSE #> 13: 0.0000000000  TRUE FALSE FALSE  TRUE   TRUE #> 14: 0.0000000000  TRUE FALSE FALSE  TRUE  FALSE #> 15: 0.0000000000  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE   TRUE #> 16: 0.4833333333  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE  FALSE #> 17: 0.0070833333 FALSE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE   TRUE #> 18: 0.0012500000 FALSE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  FALSE #> 19: 0.0000000000 FALSE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE   TRUE #> 20: 0.0000000000 FALSE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE  FALSE #> 21: 0.0030357143 FALSE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE   TRUE #> 22: 0.0005357143 FALSE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE  FALSE #> 23: 0.0000000000 FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE   TRUE #> 24: 0.0214285714 FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE  FALSE #> 25: 0.0000000000 FALSE FALSE  TRUE  TRUE   TRUE #> 26: 0.0000000000 FALSE FALSE  TRUE  TRUE  FALSE #> 27: 0.0000000000 FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE   TRUE #> 28: 0.0000000000 FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE  FALSE #> 29: 0.0000000000 FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE   TRUE #> 30: 0.0666666667 FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE  FALSE #> 31: 0.0000000000 FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE   TRUE #> 32: 0.4000000000 FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE  FALSE #>                p   vac   inf  symp  test detect # Cost effectiveness ct_undetected(data) #> [1] 0.03633929  # Relative risk reduction ct_rr(data) #> [1] 0.07709751  # Cost effectiveness ct_cost_eff(data) #> [1] 0.1651079 # Positive tests ct_pos(data) #> [1] 0.01366071  # Negative tests ct_neg(data) #> [1] 0.06907738  # True positives ct_true_pos(data) #> [1] 0.01366071  # True negatives ct_true_neg(data) #> [1] 0.06666667  # False positives ct_false_pos(data) #> [1] 0  # False negatives ct_false_neg(data) #> [1] 0.002410714  # Positive predictive value (precision) ct_ppv(data) #> [1] 1  # Negative predictive value ct_npv(data) #> [1] 0.9651012  # False discovery rate ct_fdr(data) #> [1] 0  # False omission rate ct_for(data) #> [1] 0.03489875  # True positive rate (sensitivity/recall) ct_sens(data) #> [1] 0.85  # True negative rate (specificity) ct_spec(data) #> [1] 1  # False positive rate ct_fpr(data) #> [1] 0  # False negative rate ct_fnr(data) #> [1] 0.15

title: COVID-19 Asymtomatic Screening Strategy Assessment
text: Please note {covidscreen} project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: Calculate the Steady-State Joint Distribution for a Population — calc_dist
title: Calculate the Steady-State Joint Distribution for a Population — calc_dist
text: `calc_dist()` calculates discrete joint distribution vaccination, infection, symptoms, tests, detections population.

title: Calculate the Steady-State Joint Distribution for a Population — calc_dist
code: calc_dist(   vac = list(p_comm = 0.5, p_org = 0.5, eff = 0.5),   inf = list(p_incid = 0.001, t_symp = 5, t_presymp = 5),   symp = list(p_inf_vac = 0.5, p_inf_unvac = 0.5, p_uninf = 0),   test = list(p_symp = 1, p_asymp_vac = 1/7, p_asymp_unvac = 1/7),   detect = list(sens = 0.85, spec = 1) )

title: Calculate the Steady-State Joint Distribution for a Population — calc_dist
text: vac `[list(3)]` named list containing vaccination parameters: p_comm `[numeric(1)]` Proportion vaccinated community p_org `[numeric(1)]` Proportion vaccinated organization interest eff `[numeric(1)]` Vaccine efficacy inf `[list(3)]` named list containing infection parameters: p_incid `[numeric(1)]` Proportion community newly infected day t_symp `[numeric(1)]` Duration symptomatic period t_presymp `[numeric(1)]` Duration presymptomatic period symp `[list(3)]` named lust containing symptom parameters: p_inf_vac Proportion vaccinated infections symptomatic p_inf_unvac Proportion unvaccinated infections symptomatic p_uninf Proportion uninfected people symptomatic test `[list(3)]` named list containing testing parameters: p_symp `[numeric(1)]` Probability tested symptomatic p_asymp_vac `[numeric(1)]` Probability tested asymptomatic vaccinated p_asymp_unvac `[numeric(1)]` Probability tested asymptomatic unvaccinated detect `[list(2)]` named list containing detection parameters: sens `[numeric(1)]` Test sensitivity spec `[numeric(1)]` Test specificity

what: covidscreen: COVID-19 Asymtomatic Screening Strategy Assessment — covidscreen-package
title: covidscreen: COVID-19 Asymtomatic Screening Strategy Assessment — covidscreen-package
text: Covidscreen Shiny app allows decision-makers assess benefits performing asymptomatic testing organizations. primarily aimed healthcare organizations, though applicable much wider range settings.

title: covidscreen: COVID-19 Asymtomatic Screening Strategy Assessment — covidscreen-package
text: Maintainer: Jesse Smith Jesse.Smith@stjude.org Authors: Tomi Mori Tomi.Mori@stjude.org

what: Calculate the Steady-State Joint Distribution for a Population — ct_dist
title: Calculate the Steady-State Joint Distribution for a Population — ct_dist
text: `calc_dist()` calculates discrete joint distribution vaccination, infection, symptoms, tests, detections population.

title: Calculate the Steady-State Joint Distribution for a Population — ct_dist
code: ct_dist(   vac = list(p_comm = 0.5, p_org = 0.5, eff = 0.5),   inf = list(p_incid = 0.005, t_symp = 5, t_presymp = 5),   symp = list(p_inf_vac = 0.5, p_inf_unvac = 0.5, p_uninf = 0),   test = list(p_symp = 1, p_asymp_vac = 0, p_asymp_unvac = 1/7),   detect = list(sens = 0.85, spec = 1) )

title: Calculate the Steady-State Joint Distribution for a Population — ct_dist
text: vac `[list(3)]` named list containing vaccination parameters: p_comm `[numeric(1)]` Proportion vaccinated community p_org `[numeric(1)]` Proportion vaccinated organization interest eff `[numeric(1)]` Vaccine efficacy inf `[list(3)]` named list containing infection parameters: p_incid `[numeric(1)]` Proportion community newly infected day t_symp `[numeric(1)]` Duration symptomatic period t_presymp `[numeric(1)]` Duration presymptomatic period symp `[list(3)]` named lust containing symptom parameters: p_inf_vac Proportion vaccinated infections symptomatic p_inf_unvac Proportion unvaccinated infections symptomatic p_uninf Proportion uninfected people symptomatic test `[list(3)]` named list containing testing parameters: p_symp `[numeric(1)]` Probability tested symptomatic p_asymp_vac `[numeric(1)]` Probability tested asymptomatic vaccinated p_asymp_unvac `[numeric(1)]` Probability tested asymptomatic unvaccinated detect `[list(2)]` named list containing detection parameters: sens `[numeric(1)]` Test sensitivity spec `[numeric(1)]` Test specificity

title: Add Info Modal to UI — info_modal
text: id input ID label text display info link, icon icon display info link container container wrap `actionLink`, . Defaults `tags$sup()`. ... UI elements body modal dialog box title optional title dialog footer UI footer. Use `NULL` footer. size One `"s"` small, `"m"` medium, `"l"` large, `"xl"` extra large easyClose Can modal dialog dismissed clicking outside dialog box? `FALSE`, modal dialog must dismissed clicking `modalButton()` call `removeModal()` server. fade `FALSE`, modal dialog fade-animation

title: Risk-Based Metrics — risk-metrics
text: Undetected cases primary measure risk model. , one can calculate risk reduction cost effectiveness testing. `ct_undetected()` calculates proportion undetected cases `ct_rr()` calculates reduction risk relative screening `ct_cost_eff()` calculates number cases detected per test

title: Risk-Based Metrics — risk-metrics
code: ct_undetected(dt)  ct_rr(dt, relative = TRUE)  ct_cost_eff(dt)

title: Risk-Based Metrics — risk-metrics
text: dt `[data.table]` joint distribution `ct_dist()` relative `[logical(1)]` Whether return risk reduction relative baseline risk (`TRUE`) absolute proportion organization (`FALSE`)

title: Risk-Based Metrics — risk-metrics
text: `[double]` proportion

title: Run the covidscreen Application — run_app
text: Use function run Shiny interface covidscreen R session

title: Run the covidscreen Application — run_app
code: run_app(   onStart = NULL,   options = list(),   enableBookmarking = NULL,   uiPattern = "/",   ... )

title: Run the covidscreen Application — run_app
text: onStart function called app actually run. needed shinyAppObj, since shinyAppDir case, global.R file can used purpose. options Named options passed runApp call (can following: "port", "launch.browser", "host", "quiet", "display.mode" "test.mode"). can also specify width height parameters provide hint embedding environment ideal height/width app. enableBookmarking Can one "url", "server", "disable". default value, NULL, respect setting previous calls  enableBookmarking(). See enableBookmarking() information bookmarking app. uiPattern regular expression applied GET request determine whether ui used handle request. Note entire request path must match regular expression order match considered successful. ... arguments pass golem_opts. See `?golem::get_golem_options` details.

title: Testing Metrics — test-metrics
text: number metrics available evaluate test performance. basics, one can calculate metrics. See Wikipedia page confusion matrix information metric. `ct_pos()` proportion positive tests (organization) `ct_neg()` proportion negative tests (organization) `ct_true_pos()` proportion true positive tests (org) `ct_true_neg()` proportion true negative tests (org) `ct_false_pos()` proportion false positive tests (org) `ct_false_neg()` proportion false negative tests (org) `ct_ppv()` positive predictive value test `ct_npv()` negative predictive value test `ct_fdr()` false discovery rate test `ct_for()` false omission rate test `ct_sens()` sensitivity (true positive rate) test `ct_spec()` specificity (true negative rate) test `ct_fpr()` false positive rate test `ct_fnr()` false negative rate test

title: Testing Metrics — test-metrics
code: ct_pos(dt)  ct_neg(dt)  ct_true_pos(dt)  ct_false_pos(dt)  ct_true_neg(dt)  ct_false_neg(dt)  ct_ppv(dt)  ct_npv(dt)  ct_fdr(dt)  ct_for(dt)  ct_sens(dt)  ct_spec(dt)  ct_fnr(dt)  ct_fpr(dt)

title: Testing Metrics — test-metrics
text: dt `[data.table]` distribution `ct_dist()`

title: Testing Metrics — test-metrics
text: `[numeric]` specified metric
